definition[0]: to cover or be on top of something
example[0]: The wood is overlaid with silver.
definition[1]: if one quality, sound etc overlays another, it is added to it and is often stronger or more noticeable
example[1]: The roar of the engines was overlaid by a loud banging.
example[2]: the brass fire surround with its decorative overlay
definition[3]: a transparent sheet with a picture or drawing on it which is put on top of another picture to change it
example[3]: sad stories with an overlay of humour
